Description: One ear-ring, one spacer-bead, three beads in different shapes and materials. A: One penannular ear-ring made of a glazed composition, now yellow and green in colour with a whitish corrosion layer. One finished end preserved, the rest broken off, semi-circular in section. B: One spacer-bead, two and a half segments preserved, made of light turquoise faience. C: One short cylindrical bead made of turquoise faience. D: Half a spherical glass bead, with white glass filaments as inlays running around the body. Perlescent corrosion layer apart from the white filament. E: One disc-shaped bead made of ostrich eggshell.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
